result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander T. Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(c).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Alexander T. Turner
Current: P.O. Box 232, 555 Gowen Street, Antigo, WI 54409   (Effective: 11-08-2014)
Prior: 555 Gowen Street, Antigo, WI 54409

Defendant Alexander T. Turner in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:34
Schiek/Laska/Court statement to sentencing - Court sentences to 90 days jail - credit for 105 days already sat-  each count CC  -  Unpaid costs reduced to a judgment
Appeal rights given
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.

11:52 a.m. Attorney Cana G Laska in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states record. Laska - if given credit for all time served at revocation hearing - defendant has served more time that sentence would require. Schiek statement - defendant has not oversat as sentences could be consecutive - agrees that if sentences are concurrent - defendant has sat maximum under statute. Laska additional statement to time served, DOC recommendations. Court finds that State is allowed to ask for consecutive sentences after revocation.  Court notes defendant's absence in Court. Court deems Laska's letter as Writ of Habeus Corpus - Court finds not being wrongfully held. Schiek/Laska statement to bond. Court reinstates $3500 sig bond with all previous conditions. Implied motion for Writ of Habeus Corpus - Denied. Date for revocation hearing will be obtained from JA. Adj. 12:07 p.m.
Per DA's office and attorney Maggie Hogan, correct Statute is 947.0125(2)(c) - Computer Message - Threaten/Obsenity a Class B Misdemeanor.

01:59 pm - Defendant Alexander T. Turner in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to two counts of Unlawful use of a Computer - 947.0215(2)(c) - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Hogan - Submits to Court Exhibit 1(Medical Record of Defendant) - Marked and Rec'd/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 1 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Continue counseling
Must attend school and must graduate
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given

10:12 a.m. Defendant Alexander T. Turner in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Jodie L. Bednar, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan files waiver. Defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Information filed. Hogan in receipt of Information; waives further reading. Defendant pleads not guilty. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

10:44 am - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hogan states had conversation with Mike Schiek stating the witness is out of the country - Hogan also requesting addtional records - new prelim date is being requested - Hogan told witness need not appear today.   Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Submit to Booking, No contact w/victim named in complaint, B.E.D.

02:26 pm - Defendant Alexander T. Turner in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Schiek/Hogan to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Per Denise, DA's office, reschedule initial appearance to 1-5-15.
02:15 pm - Defendant Alexander T. Turner not in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No proof of service.
